body_html:
Hm ok @ngimel I could ask our admin to upgrade CUDA, but actually we have cudnn 5, as theano is also showing (see last post).

$ head -60 /usr/local/cuda/include/cudnn.h
[...]
#if !defined(CUDNN_H_)
#define CUDNN_H_

#define CUDNN_MAJOR      5
#define CUDNN_MINOR      0
#define CUDNN_PATCHLEVEL 5

$ ls -ahl /usr/local/cuda/lib64/ | grep 'cudnn'
lrwxrwxrwx  1 1000 1000   13 Apr 25  2016 libcudnn.so -> libcudnn.so.5
lrwxrwxrwx  1 1000 1000   17 Apr 25  2016 libcudnn.so.5 -> libcudnn.so.5.0.5
-rwxr-xr-x  1 1000 1000  75M Apr 22  2016 libcudnn.so.5.0.5
-rw-r--r--  1 1000 1000  66M Apr 22  2016 libcudnn_static.a

Any reason why pytorch might say this is version 6020?

body:
Hm ok @ngimel I could ask our admin to upgrade CUDA, but actually we have cudnn 5, as theano is also showing (see last post). 

```
$ head -60 /usr/local/cuda/include/cudnn.h
[...]
#if !defined(CUDNN_H_)
#define CUDNN_H_

#define CUDNN_MAJOR      5
#define CUDNN_MINOR      0
#define CUDNN_PATCHLEVEL 5

$ ls -ahl /usr/local/cuda/lib64/ | grep 'cudnn'
lrwxrwxrwx  1 1000 1000   13 Apr 25  2016 libcudnn.so -> libcudnn.so.5
lrwxrwxrwx  1 1000 1000   17 Apr 25  2016 libcudnn.so.5 -> libcudnn.so.5.0.5
-rwxr-xr-x  1 1000 1000  75M Apr 22  2016 libcudnn.so.5.0.5
-rw-r--r--  1 1000 1000  66M Apr 22  2016 libcudnn_static.a
```

Any reason why pytorch might say this is version 6020?
